trans-unit.source: Defines a string that identifies a certificate's subject key identifier (SKI).
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class using a byte array and a value that identifies whether the extension is critical.
A byte array that represents data to use to create the extension.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the extension is critical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class using encoded data and a value that identifies whether the extension is critical.
Use this constructor if the information to create the extension is already in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object to use to create the extension.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the extension is critical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class using a public key and a value indicating whether the extension is critical.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.PublicKey"></xref> object to create a subject key identifier (SKI) from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the extension is critical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class using a string and a value that identifies whether the extension is critical.
The subject key identifier (SKI) can be used to identify the certificate and is often used when working with XML digital signing.
A string, encoded in hexadecimal format, that represents the subject key identifier (SKI) for a certificate.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the extension is critical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class using a public key, a hash algorithm identifier, and a value indicating whether the extension is critical.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.PublicKey"></xref> object to create a subject key identifier (SKI) from.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierHashAlgorithm"></xref> values that identifies which hash algorithm to use.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the extension is critical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension"></xref> class by copying information from encoded data.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object to use to create the extension.
Gets a string that represents the subject key identifier (SKI) for a certificate.
The subject key identifier (SKI) can be used to identify the certificate and is often used when working with XML digital signing.
A string, encoded in hexadecimal format, that represents the subject key identifier (SKI).
The extension cannot be decoded.
